bibl.title: Letter from A.S. von Mansfelde to Mabel H. Lazear, [19--]

div1.p: Von Mansfelde writes that he is eager to see that Carroll and Lazear receive due credit for their yellow fever work.

div1.head: Letter from A.S. von Mansfelde to Mabel H. Lazear, [19--]
div1.opener:
Mrs Mabel H Lazear
Santa Barbara
Cal.
My dear Mrs Lazier:
div1.p:
Today I received from
your husband's Uncle, Mr. Thos. C. Lazear of
Pittsburg. Pa., through the kindness of Mr James
B. Lazear, Denver, your address; and I write
you in these closing hours of the year, that
as chairman of a special committee of
the legislative Council on James Carroll
and the yellow fever commission, when in
Washington, 9th to 15 of December, I was
so intensely affected by the discrepancy
in the treatment by the Profession of Medicine
and the American Nation of Dr James Car-
roll, the living hero, and Dr Jesse W. Lazear,
the dead hero, martyrs, both of them, to
Science and Humanity, that I then and
there resolved to see this injustice righted,
as both the Profession of Medicine and the
Nation, equally ignorant of the true facts of
NEBRASKA STATE MEDICAL ASSOCIATION.

1868

1903

H. B. LEMERE, Omaha
A. E. BARTOO, Arcadia
F. A. LONG, Prest. N. S. M. A., Madison

the case, will both of them hasten to make
good their apparent neglect.

Dr. Carroll informs me that at your behest he
wrote you a letter shortly after the death of your
husband at Cuba in which he stated the true
state of affairs very plainly. I am very anxious
to read that letter, or to have a certified copy of
it. Should you send me the original, I assure
you, that I will take good care of it and re-
turn it to you as soon as possible. I further
urge you to send me such letters of your hus-
band to you, as contain descriptions of the
work he performed, and incidentally the other
members of the yellow fever commission.

I am 61 years old and I have four grown
up daughters, I say this to assure you that
I shall fully appreciate and respect the deli-
cacies that such letters are supposed to con
tain; but everything, however insignificant
it seems to you, should be provided for me,
as I mean to prosecute Dr. Carrolls and
NEBRASKA STATE MEDICAL ASSOCIATION.

Dr. Lazears rights to their ultimate con-
clusion. I saw the President for Dr. Carroll
and Lazear on Tuesday, December 11th and
by Monday Dec. 17th a bill was introduced
in the Senate, by Senator Dick of Ohio.,
S. 7238, creating Dr Carroll a Leutenant
Colonel, and to retire him with this rank
and pay.

I mean to have a bill introduced,
to pension, you with $10000 a month,
as soon as I get particulars from you,
regarding your present pension, which, I
am told is 17 dollars! And your circum
stances; the exact age of your two children
and of yourself; your means at your com-
mand et cet. Believe me, that I am
absolutely disinterested, and that my
work is in behalf of Dr. Carroll and Dr. La-
zear and their families for their good
only. With the complements of the season.
div1.closer:
I am very sincerely yours. ASvMansfelde.
I am very anxious to have a prompt letter
from you and everything as far as you can
furnish it, as requested herein.
To satisfy you fully as to my standing
and sincerity I enclose credentials given
to me this month by the President and
Secretary of the Nebraska State Medical
Association; and by my envelope you
will see that I am the Treasurer of the
Nebraska State Med. Association, hence
reliable and responsible.
Again Yours
ASM
.
Please return the credentials
in your letter to me, also
your uncles letters.
